div1.p: This bill proposes a statue and tablet to honor the members of the Yellow Fever Commission.

div1.head: Senate Bill No. 8024, May 2, 1910
div1.opener:
61ST CONGRESS,
2D SESSION.
S. 8024.
----------------------
IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES.
May 2, 1910.
Mr. OWEN introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred
to the Committee on the Library.
----------------------
div1.p:
Providing a memorial statue and tablet in honor of the members
of the Yellow Fever Commission, and for other purposes.
1 Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representa-
2 tives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,
3 That the sum of fifty thousand dollars be, and hereby is,
4 appropriated for the preparation of a site in the city of
5 Washington, District of Columbia, the erection of a pedestal,
6 and the placing thereon of a memorial statue in honor of
7 the Yellow Fever Commission, composed of Major Walter
8 Reed, surgeon, United States Army; Doctor James Carroll,
9 acting assistant surgeon, United States Army; Doctor Jesse
10 W. Lazear, acting assistant surgeon, United States Army;
11 and Doctor Aristides Agramonte, acting assistant surgeon,
12 United States Army, and the placing on the pedestal a
13 bronze tablet in memory of the men who consented and
14 assisted by the voluntary exposure of their persons in mak-
2
1 ing the experiments which resulted in the discovery of the
2 means whereby yellow fever is disseminated; the site
3 to be selected and the pedestal and statute to be erected
4 by and under the supervision of a commission composed of
5 the president of the American Medical Association, the
6 Secretary of War, Major-General Leonard Wood, United
7 States Army, the Surgeon-General, United States Army,
8 and Colonel William C. Gorgas, Medical Department, United
9 States Army.
